scale¶

Analysis of the scale of a melody.

This module analyses the scale of a melody as a Probability Density Function.

class music22.diastema.scale.Melodie(file, xmin=0, xmax=500, minFrequency=55, maxFrequency=600, freqref=300, bw_method=0.1, percent=0.5, method='mode', transpose='No', transpositionref='mode')[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to define a melody and its features

:params Audio file to be analysed or a text file containing frequencies to be analysed :return An object Melodie containing ...

__subclasshook__()¶

Abstract classes can override this to customize issubclass().

This is invoked early on by abc.ABCMeta.__subclasscheck__(). It should return True, False or NotImplemented. If it returns NotImplemented, the normal algorithm is used. Otherwise, it overrides the normal algorithm (and the outcome is cached).

analyse()[source]¶

Analyse : gets the peaks of the pdf.

get_intervals(percent=0.5, method='mode', unit='savart')[source]¶

Converts the frequencies into a linear space

percent (optional) : percent from the last frequencies to take in consideration. Default = 0.5% method (optional) : Two available methods : _pdf_ and _mode_. Default = mode unit (optional) : the Unit to use : savart of cent. Default = savart.
self.intervals : the intervals in the choosen unit.

pdf_show()[source]¶

Affichage de la fonction de la densite de probabilite

peaks()[source]¶

Obtenir les Peaks du PDF.

plot()[source]¶

Plots the melody frequencies

tonique(percent, method)[source]¶

Get the tonic frequency defined as the mode of the last frequencies array. These as selected by the percent argument. Two methods are possible : pdf or mode.

percent (optional) : a percentage of the number of frames from the total size of the frequencies array to give the last frequencies. Default percent= 8
M : the mode N : the mode converted inside an octave Final_Freqs : the last frequencies according to the percentage
transmode()[source]¶

Transpose all the frequencies by setting the mode on a given reference frequency

:params freqref : The frequency reference to be transposed to. Default = 300 ? ref : The note reference : mode or tonic. Default = mode : return the transposed frequencies
